intro: Goeppertia coccinea, commonly known as the red-tipped pineapple plant, is a member of the Zingiberaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its striking red-tipped leaves. The plant features a rosette growth habit with fleshy, lance-shaped leaves that are often variegated with green and red hues. It produces fragrant, yellow flowers that emerge from a central stem, adding ornamental value to its appearance. Goeppertia coccinea is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its vibrant foliage and ease of care.
